info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 28 at 6:54PM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Berkshire County through 730 PM EDT... At 654 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Otis, or 10 miles east of Great Barrington, moving east at 55 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Great Barrington, Lee, Sheffield, Becket, Otis, Sandisfield, Ashley Falls, New Marlborough, Monterey, Washington, Tyringham, East Sheffield, Hartsville, Konkapot, Gomorrah, New Boston, North Otis, Newsboy Statue, Montville and Alander. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 800 PM EDT for western Massachusetts.
